conclusion: To find the work done by the gas from state B to state C, use the concept of work done in a thermodynamic process.
The work done by the gas during an expansion or compression at constant pressure is given by W = P ΔV.
Pressure at state B and C, P = 2 × 10^5 Pa (constant during the process from B to C).
Volume at state B, V_B = 2 × 10^-3 m^3.
Volume at state C, V_C = 3 × 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate the change in volume ΔV = V_C - V_B = 1 × 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate the work done W = P ΔV = 200 J.
The work done by the gas from state B to state C is 200 Joules.
